originalTitle: T20 World Cup: South Africa beat India by 76 runs in Super Eight
title: T20 World Cup: South Africa beat India by 76 runs in Super Eight
content: India were bowled out for 111 chasing a 188-run target and must now win their next two games to qualify for the semis.

originalTitle: Yoga classes aim to bring moments of peace to Gazaâ€™s traumatised children
title: Yoga Fun Helps Kids in Gaza Feel Peaceful!
content:
Hello Amazing Kids!

Hello, super friends! It's your kid-friendly news reporter from Africa here. Today, we have a very special story for you. It's about children who live far, far away in a place called Gaza. These children sometimes have tough times, but something wonderful is helping them feel better. Can you guess what it is? It's yoga! Yes, yoga and lots of fun games are helping these kids find peace and happiness.

A Special Place Called Gaza

Gaza is a place where many children live, just like you. They love to play, learn, and laugh. But sometimes, things can be a little difficult there. There can be loud noises, and things might feel scary for a while. This can make children feel sad or worried inside. They might miss feeling normal and safe. But kind people are working hard to help them. They want these children to feel safe and happy again.

What is Yoga?

Have you ever heard of yoga? Yoga is a special way to move your body and breathe. It's not like running or jumping super fast. It's about slow, gentle movements. You stretch your arms and legs. You learn to breathe in a calm way. It's like giving your body and your mind a big, soft hug. It helps you feel relaxed and strong. It's also super fun! Did you know? Yoga has been around for thousands of years! People all over the world do it to feel calm and healthy.

Feeling Calm and Strong

Imagine you're a tree. You stand tall and strong, swaying gently in the wind. That's a yoga pose! Or maybe you're a happy cat, stretching your back. When the children in Gaza do these yoga movements, they learn to feel calm. They learn to make their bodies feel good. And they learn to breathe deeply. Taking a deep breath can help you feel much better when you're worried or sad. It's like magic for your feelings! When children feel worried, their bodies can feel tight. Yoga helps them relax those tight feelings. It makes them feel light and free. It helps them to think about happy things instead of worries.

More Than Just Stretching!

The special classes in Gaza are not just about quiet yoga. They also have lots of other fun things! These are called recreational activities. That's a big word, but it just means fun games and playing! The children get to play together, draw pictures, and sing songs. They get to laugh and run around. All these activities help them feel like normal kids again. They get to forget their worries and just be happy. Did you know? Playing games with friends is very important for growing up strong and happy! It helps you learn to share and work together.

Why This Helps So Much

When children go through tough times, it can make them feel a little broken inside. They might feel scared or angry. These yoga and play classes help them heal their hearts and minds. They learn that it's okay to feel sad, but also that they can find ways to feel happy again. They learn that they are not alone. They are with friends and kind teachers who care about them very much. These classes help the children recover a sense of normalcy. That means they start to feel like things are back to how they should be. They start to feel safe, happy, and just like any other child who loves to play. Even when things outside are difficult, inside the yoga class, they find a little island of peace.

Kind Teachers, Happy Kids

The grown-ups who teach these classes are super kind. They understand that the children need extra love and care. They teach the children how to move, how to breathe, and how to play. They make sure every child feels welcome and safe. It's amazing to see how a kind teacher can help so many children feel better just by teaching them to stretch and smile. Did you know? A smile is like a tiny bit of sunshine! When you smile, it can make you and others feel happier.

Bringing Peace to Hearts

These yoga classes are helping to bring peace, not just to a few children, but to many. When children feel peaceful inside, they can play better, learn better, and be better friends. They can hope for a brighter future. It shows us that even simple things, like stretching and deep breaths, can make a huge difference in the world. It helps children remember how to be happy, even when life is tough. Here in Africa, we also know how important it is for children to have places where they can feel safe, play, and learn. So, we cheer for the children in Gaza and their wonderful teachers!

What We Can Learn

This story teaches us that being kind and helping each other is very important. It shows us that children everywhere deserve to feel safe and happy. And it shows us that even simple things like yoga and playing games can bring so much joy and peace to someone's heart. Maybe you can try a few gentle stretches or take some deep breaths today and see how calm you feel!
summary: Children in Gaza, a place where life can be hard, are finding peace and happiness through special yoga and fun play classes, helping them feel normal and safe again.
whyMatters: This matters because all children, no matter where they live, deserve to feel safe, happy, and calm, and these classes help kids who have faced tough times feel good again.

originalTitle: Iranian students rally as universities reopen after nationwide protests
title: Iranian students rally as universities reopen after nationwide protests
content: Many students remain incarcerated after being taken by security forces during and after the bloody protests in January.

title: How Sheff Wed's earliest-ever relegation unfolded

title: Chelsea, Arsenal and Man City into Women's FA Cup quarters
content: Holders Chelsea edged out Manchester United to reach the quarter-finals of the Women's FA Cup, while Arsenal and Man City cruise through with comfortable wins.
